text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Sega Mark III is an 8-bit console developed by Sega in 1985 in Japan to compete with the NES. It was redesigned and rebranded as the Sega Master System (SMS) for the rest of the world one year later. Equipped with a 3.5MHz processor, 8KB of RAM, 128KB of video RAM, 3 channel mono sound and a resolution of 256x192 in 32 colors (64 with a certain programming trick). In 1987, a revision was released featuring an FM module that could be used to enhance games. However, it only had good success in the Europe, Brazil and Australasia markets.
